articles.title: Bitcoin holds below $80,000 as January prediction contracts miss liquidation-driven slide: Asia Morning Briefing - CoinDesk

articles.title: Trump family crypto firm sold major stake to UAE investment firm - The Washington Post
articles.description: The investment, worth a reported $500 million, gave Emirati-backed investors a 49 percent stake in World Liberty Financial, a Trump crypto company.

articles.title: Nvidia’s not investing $100 billion in OpenAI because the chip designer doesn’t want to pay the OpenAI valuation tax - Sherwood News
articles.description: The upshot of the WSJ report on Nvidia’s relationship with OpenAI is that the former wants you to know they’re not going to be dependent on the latter.

articles.title: Disney is Close to Picking Parks Chief D’Amaro as Next CEO - Bloomberg
articles.description: The board of Walt Disney Co. is aligning on promoting theme-park division chairman Josh D’Amaro to the role of chief executive officer and will vote on naming a new leader in the coming week, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Trump tries humor, gets some silence at black-tie dinner with ‘people I hate’ - The Washington Post
articles.description: In a frenetic presidency marked by jarring contrasts, he added another Saturday night: suiting up in black-tie regalia amid mass immigration protests and telling jokes about invading Greenland.

articles.title: CNBC Daily Open: Markets see Warsh as a safe pick for Fed chair — causing gold and silver to plunge - CNBC
articles.description: The U.S. dollar strengthened, signaling the market's approval of Warsh's credibility and perceived autonomy, but safe-haven assets gold and silver plummeted.

articles.title: South Korea stocks fall more than 4%, triggering temporary halt in trading - CNBC
articles.description: Asia-Pacific markets saw a mixed trading session as investors assessed China's factory activity for January.

articles.title: Thousands remain without power in Denver area amid Sunday outages - The Denver Post
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of Core Electric and Xcel Energy customers lost power in the southeast metro area on Sunday, including in Arapahoe and Douglas counties, according to the utilities.

articles.title: Anesthesiologist mom of 2 got 'trapped' inside Dollar Tree freezer, manager told worker on duty 'not to review' surveillance footage: Lawsuit - Law and Crime News
articles.description: A Florida anesthesiologist and mother of two wound up dead inside a faulty "walk-in freezer" at a Miami Dollar Tree last year after she "became trapped inside," her family says in $50 million lawsuit.
